name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Colorado research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Colorado ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Colorado ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Colorado research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Colorado research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Colorado Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Colorado ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Colorado Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Colorado research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Colorado Resources
    ☆ AC—Colorado State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Colorado Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Colorado Record Finder

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Colorado in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Colorado

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for Colorado.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Colorado in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Colorado

1. Explore Colorado historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Colorado History

  2. Explore Colorado history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Colorado

  3. Learn about Colorado history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Colorado History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Colorado archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Colorado archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Colorado archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Colorado Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Colorado State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Colorado.
  3. Explore the Colorado Dept of Archives site.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Colorado.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Colorado genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Colorado research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Colorado ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Colorado city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Colorado Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Colorado city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Colorado city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Colorado ☆historical directories by county.

text:

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Colorado Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Colorado Vital Records

  2. Explore links for vital records on the Colorado Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Colorado ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Colorado birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Colorado vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Colorado research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Colorado County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Colorado.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Colorado Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Colorado research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Colorado Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Colorado Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Colorado Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Colorado.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Colorado research.
  2. Explore the Colorado research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Colorado research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Colorado in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Colorado Societies

  2. Explore the Colorado Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Pikes Peak Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore Colorado genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Colorado.
Regional/Local Societies
